issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
ActiveStandbyElector shouldn't call {{monitorLockNodeAsync}} before StatCallback for previous {{zkClient.exists}} is received.
We saw RM shutdown because ActiveStandbyElector retrying monitorLockNodeAsync exceeded limit. The following is the logs.
Based on the log, it looks like multiple {{monitorLockNodeAsync}} are called at the same time due to back-to-back SyncConnected event received.
The current code doesn't prevent {{zkClient.exists}} from being called before AsyncCallback.StatCallback for previous {{zkClient.exists}} is received.
So the retry for {{monitorLockNodeAsync}} doesn't work correctly sometimes.
{code}

fields.summary: ActiveStandbyElector shouldn't call monitorLockNodeAsync multiple times

comments.body: I attached a patch HADOOP-12186.000.patch which prevent {{zkClient.exists}} from being called before AsyncCallback.StatCallback for previous {{zkClient.exists}} is received.

The test failure(TestCallQueueManager) is due to an issue at CallQueueManager, I created HADOOP-12189 to fix this issue.

Patch looks good to me.

Will commit soon.
